author: Special Correspondent
text:
on a green mission:An international group of volunteers of ‘Art of Living’ planting saplings on the bank of Semmangundu oorani in Ramanathapuram on Wednesday.— Photo: L. Balachandar

An international group of volunteers of ‘Art of Living’ undertook a three-day ‘padayatra’ in the district, creating awareness of he importance of green and clean environment and planting tree saplings.

The 35-member group, including 25 women from France, Germany, Japan, Russia, Canada and the US, launched the programme at Chitharkottai panchayat on Monday and completed their mission after planting tree saplings on the bank of Semmangundu oorani near here on Wednesday. “This was part of a massive green and clean environment campaign launched in the State by Art of Living,” its spokesperson said.

Over 450 in TN

More than 450 international volunteers visited various parts of the State for the past three days, he said. The volunteers, who had visited 13 villages in the Chitharkottai panchayat on the first two days, educated the people on health hazards posed by open defecation and advised them to use toilets. They also conducted de-stressing programmes for villagers and offered blessings.
title: The art of spreading a green message
